title: The Study of Rosmer's conflict and tragic life as seen through Ibsen's Rosmersholm
abstract: This thesis is the study of confliot and tragio life of Ibsen's fuwmerflho.lm. It will analyze a oharaoter who will face a whole series of problem when he attempts to break with the conservative world. Ibsen's oharacter in this play will experience some varios oontoversies while he is eager to convert people's minds into liberal viewpoint. The external and internal oonfliot will show how hard the character has to struggle against himself and other people who work with their own problems. Dealing with the conflicts themselves, the oharaoter also experiences a tragic life since he is not able to escape from the problems that he faces. Ultimately, a condition like this leads the character in his downfall. In short, some oause of his tragedy will emerge as a fact that he cannot break with the established world.
contributors: Jenny Mochtar Djundjung (Examination Committee 1); ANTONIUS GURITO (Advisor 1)
subjects: IBSEN, HENRIK, 1828-1906. ROSMERSHOLM-STUDY AND TEACHING; NORWEGIAN DRAMA-CENTURY-STUDY AND TEACHING
